meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being serial.
meanings.sent1: The seriality of the TV show kept viewers hooked for weeks.
meanings.sent2: The seriality of the numbers made it easy to follow the pattern.
meanings.sent3: The detective couldn't solve the case due to the mysterious seriality of events.
meanings.sent4: The seriality of the chapters in the book created a sense of anticipation.
meanings.sent5: The seriality of the music notes formed a beautiful melody.

meanings.definition: The state of being arranged in a series.
meanings.sent1: The seriality of the books on the shelf made them easy to find.
meanings.sent2: The seriality of the tasks helped in completing them one by one.
meanings.sent3: The seriality of the vegetables in the grocery store amused the customers.
meanings.sent4: The seriality of the stars in the sky created a mesmerizing pattern.
meanings.sent5: The seriality of the colors in the rainbow was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of occurring in a series or sequence.
meanings.sent1: The seriality of the events in the story made it captivating.
meanings.sent2: The seriality of the days passing by reminded her of the upcoming deadline.
meanings.sent3: The seriality of the jokes in the comedy show entertained the audience.
meanings.sent4: The seriality of the waves crashing on the shore was calming.
meanings.sent5: The seriality of the cars on the highway created a rhythmic flow.
